nodes.bodyText: Why do we depend on a snapshot version here? Can we do a proper release for TeraMath, please?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -150,10 +150,12 @@ dependencies {
     api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'gestalt-module', version: '5.1.5'
     api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'gestalt-util', version: '5.1.5'
     api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'gestalt-asset-core', version: '5.1.5'
-    api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'TeraMath', version: '1.4.0'
+    api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'TeraMath', version: '1.5.1-SNAPSHOT'

nodes.bodyText:
No particular reason, same situation as TeraBullet I think, just been a low activity area + there's a looming replacement on the horizon (JOML)
Has a similar build job in the old Jenkins which probably works, but hasn't been touched for nearly two years: http://jenkins.terasology.org/view/Ext/job/TeraMath/
It looks like it is configured to handle either snapshots or releases from the develop branch, I would guess it will figure it out from the version property, wherever it is. Just can't guarantee it without trying it :-) Would need to be triggered manually like TeraBullet (old GitHub trigger is broken)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -150,10 +150,12 @@ dependencies {
     api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'gestalt-module', version: '5.1.5'

     api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'gestalt-asset-core', version: '5.1.5'
-    api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'TeraMath', version: '1.4.0'
+    api group: 'org.terasology', name: 'TeraMath', version: '1.5.1-SNAPSHOT'

nodes.bodyText: There's only been one commit since the TeraMath's last release. My hunch is that it's not necessary for the success of this PR, so I've rolled the dependency back to the last TeraMath release, 1.5.0.

nodes.bodyText: RectUtility::createFromMinAndSize and in turn Border#shrink can produce invalid Rectangle2i (e.g, by RectUtility.createFromMinAndSize(20, 20, -10, -10)). I'm not sure where/how we want to fix this... @pollend ?
